message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI for the Flight Booking Form should allow users to input details about their flight such as departure and return dates, origin and destination, the number of passengers, and the class of service. The form should be organized, visually clear, and easy to navigate. Consistent spacing, legible fonts, and clear call-to-action buttons are essential for better user experience. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **FormContainer**: Standalone - **InputField**: Standalone - **SelectField**: Standalone - **Button**: Standalone - **DatePicker**: Standalone 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Book Your Flight

``` This setup provides a simple, accessible, and responsive flight booking form using Tailwind CSS components. Each element is designed for easy use and readability, following accessibility and best design practices.

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI for the survey/questionnaire form should look clean and structured. It should have a form title at the top, followed by multiple questions, each with either input boxes or selection options (like radio buttons or checkboxes). At the end, there should be a submit button. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **FormContainer**: Standalone component, wraps the entire form content. - **FormTitle**: Standalone component, displays the title of the form. - **QuestionBlock**: Standalone component, represents a single question and its associated answer components. - **SubmitButton**: Standalone component, the button used to submit the form. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html ``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **FormContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **FormTitle**: ```html

{form_title}

``` - **QuestionBlock**: ```html

{question_text}

``` - **SubmitButton**: ```html ```

1) What should the UI look like? The UI for the "Related Posts" display should be a grid or list of post previews, each containing a thumbnail, title, and a brief excerpt. It should be visually appealing and informative, encouraging users to click on other articles. Each post should be presented in a card-like format, making it easy to distinguish between different posts. The UI should be responsive, adapting seamlessly from mobile to desktop views. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **RelatedPostsContainer**: A standalone component that serves as the outer wrapper for the related posts. - **PostCard**: A standalone component that displays information for a single post, such as the thumbnail, title, and excerpt. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **RelatedPostsContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **PostCard**: ```html
{post_title}

{post_excerpt}

```

prompt: Clickable text that navigates to another page or resource

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI will have a simple clickable text element, which is commonly referred to as a "link". This element will be styled to look distinct from regular text, perhaps with a different color or underline, to indicate that it is interactive and navigates to another page or resource when clicked. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **ClickableLink (Standalone)**: This component represents a hyperlink that users can click to navigate to a specific URL. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **ClickableLink**: ```html Click here ``` Here, `{target_url}` is a placeholder to be replaced with the actual URL where the link should navigate when clicked. The classes are from TailwindCSS, styling the link with different colors for normal, hover, and visited states.

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of horizontal separator lines and vertical separator lines, used to divide sections or contents visually on a web page. These separators can enhance the visual organization of content and improve readability. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **HorizontalSeparator** (Standalone): A horizontal line used to separate content in layouts horizontally. - **VerticalSeparator** (Standalone): A vertical line used to separate content in layouts vertically. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Content above the horizontal separator

Content below the horizontal separator

Content to the left of the vertical separator

Content to the right of the vertical separator

``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **HorizontalSeparator**: ```html
``` - **VerticalSeparator**: ```html
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a grid layout displaying thumbnails of images. Each thumbnail can be clicked to open a larger view of that image, often referred to as a lightbox. This larger view typically darkens the rest of the screen and focuses the user‚Äôs attention on the viewed image. It may also provide navigation to move between images while in the enlarged mode and a close button to exit back to the gallery view. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **Gallery**: Standalone component that contains multiple `Thumbnail` components. - **Thumbnail**: Component that takes children. Displays a small preview of an image and triggers the lightbox view on click. - **Lightbox**: Component that takes children. Displays the enlarged image and includes UI for closing the view or navigating between images. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Image Gallery

``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **Gallery**: ```html
``` - **Thumbnail**: ```html
{children}
``` - **Lightbox**: ```html
{children}
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a button labeled "Retweet" with a simple icon suggestive of sharing or retweeting (we'll simulate this with text since SVGs are not allowed). The button should be visually appealing and easy to spot, ideally with a contrasting color to stand out. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **RetweetButton**: Standalone. This component will represent the retweet button, including visual styles and the labeled text. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **RetweetButton**: ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI should feature a Callout Box which is a special container element designed to draw attention. This box should contain a heading, a short description or message, and a link for further action, such as "Learn More" or "Sign Up". The box should have a visually distinct style, possibly with a slightly different background color or border to stand out from other content. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **CalloutBox**: A standalone component that encapsulates the heading, description, and link. - **ActionButton**: A child component nested within the `CalloutBox` that represents the link for further action. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **CalloutBox**: ```html

{headingText}

{descriptionText}

``` - **ActionButton**: ```html {buttonText} ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI for the Alert Notification Box should be a simple, visually distinct container that displays a message to the user. Depending on the alert type (info, warning, error, success), the box's background and border colors should change to reflect the urgency or nature of the message. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **AlertBox**: A standalone component that visually indicates different types of alerts by using varying colors and icons. It does not take children. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **AlertBox**: ```html
{alert_type}! {alert_message}
``` In this setup: - `{alert_type}` is a string indicating the type of the alert (e.g., "Error", "Warning", "Info", "Success"). - `{alert_message}` is a string containing the message the alert displays. - `{alert_background_color}`, `{alert_border_color}`, and `{alert_text_color}` are strings representing CSS color values appropriate for different alert types.

1) **UI Description**: The UI should feature an interactive map with various buttons or controls that allow users to apply different visual effects to the map. These effects could be things like color adjustments, brightness, or overlay filters. The UI will be simple, with a map display area and a tool section for the effect controls. 2) **Components of the UI**: - **MapContainer** (Standalone): This component will hold the interactive map. - **EffectControls** (Standalone): This component will contain different buttons or sliders for applying effects to the map. 3) **HTML Structure for the UI**: ```html
``` 4) **HTML for Each Component**: - **MapContainer**: ```html
